review: I love my Amazon Prime account, but could never get Prime movies to play well on my HD TV.  The Fire TV Stick does it perfectly.  In addition, there are a host of free and inexpensive apps that bring news, entertainment and games to my TV - all with a device I plug into an open HDMI slot.The Fire TV Stick comes with an approximately 4-5" HDMI extension so it can fit into the tightest HDMI slots and still allow you to plug the Stick into an external power source (power cord comes with the Fire TV Stick and is recommended for best performance).I also love that I can pull the Fire TV Stick out of my TV, put it into my pocket and take it travelling with me.  I don't even need to take the remote control because there is a great (free) remote control application for my Android phone that allow me to control the Fire TV Stick from my phone (using WiFi).Occasionally I need to reset the device when it freezes (very seldom).  Simply hold the center control button and "play" button simultaneously for about 6-10 seconds.  Then the device works perfectly again.  (Just like every other electronic device, it needs to be "rebooted" occasionally).The best device for my TV I've ever had.
author: Robert A. Bergman

review: Got a strange blue screen "content unavailable " for the 1st two days I had it but had sound in all my movie apps on the stick.Took a ton of trouble shooting, port cleanings, power cyvles to just get it started. Had to shuffle the stick around in my home hdmi ports and power cycle it multiple times in order to finally see a show. Additionally to truly power cycle it I had to physically remove it from the port after unplugging the power supply as opposed to just unplugging the adapter. It would nit restart unless i did so. A real nuisance for my wall mounted LTD and Plasma. Had it for 3 days now and will amend review as updates come along. It's a "beta" stick for them so I hope for a more stable solution or off to Chrome I go.
